hackathon-description-text: Winter WonderHack is a 36-hour hackathon that takes place at Michigan Tech. Students from across the midwest come here to show their passion for making
hackathon-eligibility: Current students and those who have been a student within the past year are eligible. Teams may be one ot four people. All work submitted for consideration must be completed at the location and over duration of the event.
hackathon-requirements: Select the categories, resources and technolgies used in your submission and upload a description of the purpose and function of you project. This may be in the form of a video, presentation, images or other media. Keep it brief - e.g. limit videos to no more than three minutes - and general. Judges will be visiting your project at the expo.
hackathon-rules:
All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at Winter WonderHack are required to abide by the 
 throughout the event to ensure a safe and supportive environment.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Projects in this category solve a student-centric problem, regardless of the size of impact.
This prize will be awarded to the team that creates the most industrially practical project with a focus on autonomy.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most practical use of mechanical and electrical technology

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!
$30 Amazon.com Gift Cards for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your skills and knowledge to create a method that improves an aspect of the health care industry. This can relate to members, doctors, providers or a combination of the three. For example, getting members to stick to a medication adherence program can drastically improve their quality of life. Stop by with questions!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1400 Townsend Dr, Houghton, MI 49931, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Quality and innovative nature of the idea / demo
Compelling and challenging use of the technologies and tools

hackathon-description-header: Don't Escape the Cold! Embrace it!
